page.title: 18Floods in Sheerness
page.content: Sheerness has suffered from several{floods}the worst being in 1953. A local resident told us of her childhood{memories. Seeing the{sea}on her doorstep the initial reaction was one of excitement but she soon realised she would have to stay in all day. An amusing memory was of the police inspector across the road climbing into a boat which had come to collect him. On stepping aboard it capsized tipping him into the flood water. The flood caused much damage to the{housing.}The RAF were called in to dry them out using hot air pumps. Plaster was knocked down and replaced. Today problems still arise with salt in the bricks causing dampness. Only last year her house had to be damp proofed once again.
